testSteps.description: Send message button should be visible

assertions.text: Send button on the chat should be not be the default button whereas it should render as per the action taken by the user

evidence.description: Text input field shows message being composed ('Hello test mess') with keyboard visible, but send button not yet transformed
Complete message 'Hello test message!' typed with green circular send button visible on the right side of the input area
After message is sent, input field is empty and the button has reverted to a microphone icon (for voice messages) instead of send arrow
Confirms the microphone icon persists when input is empty, demonstrating dynamic button rendering based on user action

assertions.explanation: The assertion states that the send button should not be a default button but should render based on user action. Throughout the sequence, we observe dynamic send button behavior: When the message input is empty (frames 58, 66, 70), the send button appears as a microphone icon (voice message button). However, once the user types text (frames 27-55), the button transforms into a green send arrow. This demonstrates that the button is indeed rendered conditionally based on user input rather than displaying as a static default button, which is the expected forgiving and intentional interaction pattern.
